Posts.Content: boobieprized wrote: ;)   As much as chemo kicks my butt, I am enjoying the small things.   My showers now take about 3 minutes tops.  Also, not worrying about blowing out my hair. My period hasn't made its arrival yet.  I'm not missing it. The support friends and family have given me shows how compassionate people can be and are. Not feeling guilty for taking naps. ;) I'm sure there are more, but today is ramping up day and I want to get some things done before tomorrow's chemo. oncotype dx score 27 Dx 1/31/2014, IDC, 1cm, Stage IA, Grade 3, 0/2 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Chemotherapy 4/25/2014 Cytoxan (cyclophosphamide), Taxotere (docetaxel) Chemotherapy 5/16/2014 Cytoxan (cyclophosphamide), Taxotere (docetaxel) Chemotherapy 6/6/2014 Cytoxan (cyclophosphamide), Taxotere (docetaxel) Chemotherapy 6/27/2014 Cytoxan (cyclophosphamide), Taxotere (docetaxel) Radiation Therapy 8/11/2014 Breast, Lymph nodes Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Do we do silver linings here? boobieprized tangandchris
